intro: Diodia teres var. hystricina, commonly known as the narrowleaf dottle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale green flowers in umbel-like clusters, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and antispasmodic properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets.
